title: Elon Musk's Chinese paradoxes
summary: The multi-billionaire is in a singular position: A close adviser to Donald Trump, he is also the owner of Tesla, a company well established in the country designated enemy number one by the new American administration.

title: 'Charlie Hebdo' office attacker sentenced to 30 years in prison
summary: Zaheer Mahmoud attacked two people near the former offices 'Charlie Hebdo' in 2020. He said he had been looking to avenge the Prophet Muhammad because blasphemy is punishable by death in his country, Pakistan.

title: Middle East latest: Gaza ceasefire holds as Israel cracks down in the West Bank
summary: In the days since the fragile ceasefire took hold in the Gaza Strip, Israel has launched a major military operation in the occupied West Bank city of Jenin, where at least 10 people have been killed, the Palestinian Health Ministry says.

title: 'A very bad idea': Two economists respond to White House citing them on 20% tariffs
summary: Stephen Miran, the new head of the Council of Economic Advisors, cited work by researchers Arnaud Costinot and Andres Rodriguez-Clare to justify Trump's plans for high tariffs. At Le Monde's request, the two economists responded in this op-ed.

title: Trump pardons anti-abortion activists who blockaded clinic entrances
summary: In the first week of Trump's presidency, anti-abortion advocates have ramped up calls for Trump to pardon protesters charged with violating the Freedom of Access to Clinic Entrances Act, which is designed to protect abortion clinics from obstruction and threats.

title: At Paris Men's Fashion Week, a dazzling restraint
summary: From cargo pants embroidered with pearls at Louis Vuitton to hoodies under a large coat at Auralee and weathered leather jackets at Paul Smith, men's basics come in all shades.

title: Trump orders release of last JFK, RFK and MLK assassination files
summary: Thousands of Kennedy assassination-related documents were released during Trump's first term, but he also held some back on national security grounds. Then-president Joe Biden said at the time of the December 2022 documents release that a 'limited' number of files would continue to be held back at the request of unspecified 'agencies.'

title: UnitedHealth promotes one of its executives to replace CEO Thompson, who was fatally shot in NYC
summary: 50-year-old Brian Thompson was fatally shot on December 4 outside a New York City hotel in Midtown as he walked to UnitedHealth Group’s annual investor meeting.

title: In Sweden, the negligence of the prime minister's security advisor provokes outrage
summary: A childhood friend of the head of government, Henrik Landerholm has admitted leaving his phone and several sensitive documents in public places. The center-left opposition is calling for him to step down.

title: US judge temporarily blocks Trump's order to end birthright citizenship
summary: Senior US District Judge John Coughenour called the order 'blatantly unconstitutional' and said he had never encountered a clearer case.

title: Speakers at Davos attack 'engineers of chaos'
summary: Psychologist Steven Pinker, a guest speaker at the World Economic Forum, insisted that the world isn't as bad as it seems on social media.

title: French culture minister: 'On AI, the American model is not the European model'
summary: Ahead of the Artificial Intelligence Action Summit on February 10 and 11 in Paris, Rachida Dati is trying to alleviate concerns within the cultural sector about copyright. One proposed solution is the collective management of AI-related rights.

title: Oscars 2025: Jacques Audiard's 'Emilia Pérez' sets record with 13 nominations for non-English language film
summary: The musical drama leads the field ahead of 'The Brutalist,' 'Wicked,' 'Conclave' and 'A Complete Unknown.'

title: Donald Trump's historic turn in the White House: "common sense revolution" or conservative reaction?
summary: The new American president's pardon for the Capitol Hill rioters, including the most violent among them, and challenge to anti-discrimination policies illustrate a state, moral and societal upheaval.

title: UK judge sentences teenager who killed three girls to at least 52 years in jail
summary: The judge highlighted the 'extreme violence' of the knife attack on the girls at a dance event and added that the 18-year-old attacker is unlikely ever to be released.

title: European court backs Frenchwoman divorced for refusing sex
summary: The European Court of Human Rights condemned France for granting a divorce over a wife's refusal of sex, affirming her rights to privacy and bodily autonomy.

title: Iranian Nobel laureate urges French lawmakers to prioritize human rights in Tehran talks
summary: Narges Mohammadi, who has been incarcerated for three years but was temporarily released on medical leave, also called for the 'end' of the Islamic republic.

title: The first steps of a hopeful Syria through the eyes of photographer Abdulmonam Eassa
summary: Originally from Ghouta, a Damascus suburb bombed with chemical weapons in 2013, photographer Abdulmonam Eassa fled Syria seven years ago. With the fall of Bashar al-Assad, he managed to return to his country and document the liberation of his people.

title: Hegseth told senator he paid $50,000 to woman who accused him of 2017 sex assault
summary: Per a report obtained by The Associated Press, written answers regarding the payment were provided to Massachusetts Democratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren in response to questions she had for Trump's defense secretary pick Pete Hegseth as part of the vetting process. A final vote on Hegseth is expected Friday.

title: Norway accused of profiting from war in Ukraine
summary: According to the finance ministry in Oslo, the country has reaped 1,270 billion kroner (€107.7 billion) in additional revenue thanks to higher gas prices and production. It has been criticized for allocating only a fraction of this on aid to Ukraine.

title: 'Joe Biden belonged to the 'before' generation, for whom political rivals were not enemies'
summary: Despite undeniable economic successes, Joe Biden's indecision when it came to Russia or high US inflation were not unrelated to Donald Trump's return to power, writes columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Progress is made on a huge fire north of Los Angeles while new fires erupt in Southern California
summary: The state Legislature on Thursday approved a more than $2.5 billion fire relief package, in part to help the Los Angeles area recover from the fires. Trump plans to travel to the state to see the damage firsthand Friday, but it wasn't clear whether he and Democratic Gov. Gavin Newsom will meet during the visit.

title: In Ukraine, several officer arrests shed light on army malfunctions
summary: With the French-trained 'Anne of Kyiv' brigade having seen a proliferation of desertions, its former commander has been arrested, along with two generals and a colonel, accused of failing to take adequate measures to defend the Kyiv region.

title: Wembanyama dazzles Paris crowd as he leads Spurs to easy win
summary: San Antonio Spurs center Victor Wembanyama was playing in the French league a year and a half ago before becoming the number-one pick in the 2023 NBA draft. French four-time champion Tony Parker, Manu Ginobili and David Robinson, as well as Pau Gasol and Oscar Robertson, all attended Thursday's game in Paris against the Indiana Pacers.

title: From Nicole Kidman to Demi Moore, the bodies of 50-something actresses in the age of digital puritanism
summary: Several recent films, including Halina Reijn's 'Babygirl,' feature blossoming romances between women and younger partners. This is hypocritical at a time when the digital age has erased the very notion of flesh.

title: Fired for refusing to fly back to Europe from Papua New Guinea, a researcher wins compensation in court
summary: Gianluca Grimalda traveled 28,000 kilometers back from a research trip in Papua New Guinea by train, cargo ship, ferry and car, a 72-day journey through 16 countries, in order to limit his carbon footprint.

title: Saudi crown prince says kingdom intends to invest $600 billion in US during call with Trump
summary: The White House issued a statement acknowledging the call, saying the two leaders 'discussed efforts to bring stability to the Middle East, bolster regional security and combat terrorism.' Trump suggested he might be able to bring the total proposed Saudi investment even higher: 'I'll be asking the crown prince, who's a fantastic guy, to round it out to around $1 trillion.'

title: PFAS: France's drinking water is massively contaminated by 'forever chemicals,' including in Paris
summary: Two separate campaigns conducted by the Eurofins laboratory and the UFC-Que Choisir and Générations Futures associations reveal high concentrations of trifluoroacetic acid (TFA).

title: Buckwheat, a tiny seed with huge benefits
summary: It's a favorite with chefs and gluten-free enthusiasts alike. Whether in crepes, chips, granola, soups or tea, this iconic Brittany plant is winning over France.

title: At Davos, Hurricane Trump highlights international rifts
summary: On Thursday, the American president spoke via video from the White House. The consequences of his return to power are at the heart of the debates at the meeting that opened on Monday.

title: At Sarkozy's trial, relatives of victims of Libyan terrorism denounce Gaddafi rehabilitation
summary: The 1989 bombing of UTA flight 772 killed 170 people of 18 nationalities, including 54 French citizens. In court, the victims' families expressed their pain at how former president Nicolas Sarkozy renewed ties with the late Libyan leader.

title: Louvre president warns of dilapidated buildings
summary: In a letter to the French Culture Minister Rachida Dati, Laurence des Cars expresses her concern about defects in watertightness endangering works of art and inadequate reception conditions for a growing number of visitors.

title: Kidnappers of French crypto figure and his wife arrested after massive manhunt
summary: David Balland, co-founder of the Ledger company, was abducted from his home along with his wife on the morning of Tuesday, January 21. They were successfully rescued by law enforcement. Ten people, aged between 20 and 40, were arrested and taken into custody.

title: Frenchman on death row in Indonesia will be sent home
summary: Serge Atlaoui, 61, who had been sentenced to death for drug offenses in Indonesia in 2007 and has long proclaimed his innocence, is now due to be sent back to France, after months of talks between the two countries.

title: France asks EU to delay rights, environment business rules
summary: The call comes as Brussels has vowed to make life easier for firms complaining about excessive regulation, as the 27-nation bloc scrambles to revamp its economic competitiveness.

title: Storm Eowyn hits Ireland and Scotland
summary: Hundreds of thousands of homes lost power as gusts of 183 kilometers per hour lashed the western coast of Ireland. In Scotland, hundreds of schools were closed and train operator ScotRail suspended all services.

title: How California became Republicans' punching bag
summary: Donald Trump is visiting fire-ravaged Los Angeles on Friday to practice the transactional approach he now intends to apply to relations between Washington and the US states: no humanitarian aid without a minimum of cooperation.

title: At Davos, business leaders are fascinated and concerned with 'deal-maker' Trump
summary: Even the elites of the World Economic Forum are seduced by the American president's forceful actions. To the point of forgetting the contradictions and risks of his agenda.

title: Russia delivers armored vehicles to Mali and restructures military presence
summary: Around 100 vehicles, including light tanks and armored vehicles, arrived in Bamako from Guinea on January 17, just as the Russian Defense Ministry intends to speed up the replacement of the Wagner group by Africa Corps in the country. Le Monde traced the convoy.

title: DRC regional governor killed on front line fighting against M23 rebels
summary: The DRC army and M23 rebels clashed on Friday outside Goma as the United Kingdom, United States and France urged citizens to leave the main city in DRC's volatile east, warning that the situation could deteriorate rapidly.

title: French skier Alexis Pinturault airlifted from course with knee injury
summary: The three-time Olympic medallist, making his comeback after rupturing a knee ligament a year ago, crashed in a men's World Cup super-G on Friday.
